RumorFact.Text: I've heard rumors of a fourth planet with a transforming surface.

ExploreFact.Text: The Distant Enigma is the fourth planet of the Strangers' Homeworld.
Bark hinted that this planet is quantum, and has three states.
The first state has hard, dark ice, but seem to have some dents in them.
The second state has lakes of poisonous water.
The third state has thin, bright ice.

RumorFact.Text: According to Twig, the head of the Inhabitants' Space Program, there are other travelers, each carrying a signal. I sometimes hear one coming from the distance, of what could be a fourth planet.

ExploreFact.Text: I met a travelling inhabitant named Bark, but he's only alive on the first state.
I found a lab on Distant Enigma's First State.
Researchers found that Distant Enigma exists at the intersection of three timelines. They also mention the lab changes each state.
On the third state, they discovered a machine powered by a mineral. It was deemed too risky to interact with.

Shown in a picture on one of the tables is a scratch in the ice of the current state. The researchers say it marks the location of a light sensor submerged in the poison state. The sensor will be easier to find if an object that can emit light is placed near the scratch before changing states.
Shown in a picture on one of the tables is a crack in the ice of the current state. The researchers say a heavy object here may shatter the ice in a different state.
I found a lab on Distant Enigma's Second State....but it's all broken.
It seems the lab was torn down and all operations within were moved to the volcanic moon.

According to some text I saw lying near the shores of the second state, taking a photo of a quantum object increases that object's weight. This effect persists, so a photo can be taken once and then put away.
I found a lab on Distant Enigma's Third State, but it seems blocked...
I made my way into the blocked lab with the door interface hidden beneath the liquid on the second state! Behind the door is an odd machine...
The machine is tuned to increase the quantum weight of nearby quantum objects, thus decreasing their range.
The engineers determined that the machine is safe to interact with.
I found a base on Distant Enigma's First State. It doesn't seem to appear on the second or third states.
The Strangers' Inhabitants set up a biometric authentication system to prevent alien espionage.
The biometrics are flawed, and will unlock in the presence of a deceased inhabitant skull.

RumorFact.Text: On the Ringed Giant, I saw an abandoned structure. On one of the slots it had a picture of a rocky, magenta planet. Could this be the fourth planet?

ExploreFact.Text: I found a square piece of metal under the ice of the third state. It looks like it fits somewhere...
When I put the seal in the structure, it gave me a symbol.

RumorFact.Text: A few inhabitant-sized stalls are found throughout Distant Enigma. What is their purpose?

ExploreFact.Text: The stalls change the state of Distant Enigma!

RumorFact.Text: There's a light sensor that will open the way to the lab on the thin-ice state. I need to use something that emits light and takes pictures.

ExploreFact.Text: I found an interface with my scout using the scratch marks and changing states.

RumorFact.Text: There's a picture showing cracks on the dark-ice state. Some text says it's diagonally to the right of the lab from where you exit.
Bark says he found the crack by his ship near the lab.

ExploreFact.Text: I found a crack on Distant Enigma's first state, by Bark's Ship.

RumorFact.Text: There's a picture showing a scratch mark on the dark-ice state. Some text says it's directly behind the lab somewhere.
Bark says he saw the scratch about 120 meters south of the lab, situated next to a lantern.

ExploreFact.Text: I found scratch marks on Distant Enigma's first state.
I found Bark's dead corpse on one of Distant Enigma's other two states...
I can pull out Bark's skull and pick it up.
